voice_instruct: Older man, 50s, commanding bass-baritone with weathered gravitas. Maynard James Keenan's controlled intensity meets a Southern gospel preacher's fire. Capable of complex melodic phrases that shift into powerful call-and-response congregational singing. Voice carries the weight of terrible sins and the desperate hunger for redemption. Authoritative yet humble, a warlord turned prophet.

tracks.title: The Thrill
tracks.prompt: prog rock gospel fusion, verse: Tool-style odd time signature 7/8 heavy riff with bass-driven groove, dark and seductive, male vocals low and menacing, chorus: shifts to 4/4 with gospel choir erupting in call-and-response, Hammond organ swelling beneath prog guitar harmonics, drums switching from complex fills to marching stomp, the tension between sinful temptation and spiritual awakening, 110 BPM
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The red mist descends upon the battlefield,
And something in me opens that was sealed,
A hunger deeper than a man should know,
The Thrill says fight, the Thrill says go,
Blood on gauntlets, bone on steel,
The only time I truly feel,
Is when the killing makes me whole,
And I surrender to the pull,

[chorus - call and response]
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
It takes and it takes,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
But something in me breaks,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
Lord what have I done,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
I was the Blackthorn's son,

[verse 2]
Seven/four time, the rhythm of a war,
Complex patterns hiding what the violence is for,
Nergaoul whispers, ancient Unmade song,
I've been dancing to the devil all along,
Evi in the flames, Rathalas burns,
And the Thrill retreats because it only yearns
For willing vessels, and tonight I see
The monster that it made of me,

[chorus - call and response]
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
No more, no more,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
I've been keeping score,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
Every life I stole,
(Oh the Thrill, the Thrill!)
Lord, redeem my soul,

[bridge]
Put down the sword,
Put down the crown,
Let the Blackthorn die,
Let the old man drown,

[outro]
The Thrill fades like a false god should,
And in the silence, something good

tracks.title: The Most Important Words
tracks.prompt: prog rock gospel fusion, epic and redemptive: 5/4 prog intro with clean arpeggiated guitar building to massive gospel choir revelation, pipe organ meets distorted bass, male vocal shifts from whispered confession to full-throated revival preaching, 100 BPM accelerating to 120 at climax, dynamics from near-silence to overwhelming wall of voices and instruments, congregational handclaps in final chorus
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
The most important step a man can take,
It's not the first one, for the first one's sake,
It's the next one, always the next,
After the fall, after the wrecked
Remains of everything you thought you'd be,
The next step forward is the one that's free,

[chorus - congregation]
The most important Words a man can say!
(Are the ones he speaks today!)
Not the first oath that he swore,
(But the next one, evermore!)
I will unite instead of divide!
(Unite instead of divide!)
I will take responsibility!
(Can't run, can't hide!)

[verse 2]
I killed my wife in Rathalas fire,
Drunk on the Thrill, the empire's desire,
Erased the memories so I could sleep,
But the Nightwatcher's price was mine to keep,
Now they return, each one a blade,
Each memory of the monster that I made,
And I will not flee, I face them all,
The next step matters most after the fall,

[chorus - congregation]
The most important Words a man can say!
(Are the ones he speaks today!)
Not the first oath that he swore,
(But the next one, evermore!)
I will unite instead of divide!
(Unite instead of divide!)
I will take responsibility!
(Can't run, can't hide!)

[bridge - spoken over organ]
You cannot have my pain,
You cannot have my guilt,
You cannot have the ruins
Of everything I've built,

[final chorus]
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
The most important step is always next,
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)

tracks.title: Oathbringer
tracks.prompt: prog rock gospel fusion, heavy and majestic: Tool-style polyrhythmic drumming in 11/8 for verses, massive downtuned guitar riff, shifts to straight-time gospel stomp for choruses with full choir and brass section, bass solo bridge in odd meter, male vocals commanding and prophetic, church bells and war drums layered, 105 BPM, epic scope crescendo building over 4 minutes
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I am the man who burned Rathalas,
I am the fist the kingdom fears,
I held a Blade before I held a prayer,
I held a throne before I held my tears,
Oathbringer in my hands weighs nothing,
But the oaths I broke could sink the world,
Prog complexity in every measure,
Like the schemes I wove and then unfurled,

[chorus]
Bring me the oaths I've broken,
Bring me the Words unspoken,
Bring me the dead I cannot save,
And I will carry them beyond the grave,
Bring me the oaths! (Bring them!)
Bring me the oaths! (Bring them!)

[verse 2]
Stormfather bound to broken vessel,
Reluctant god meets reluctant man,
But the Almighty chose a weapon
Forged by failure, that's the plan,
Because a sword that's never broken
Doesn't know the cost of steel,
And a man who's never fallen
Doesn't know redemption's zeal,

[chorus]
Bring me the oaths I've broken,
Bring me the Words unspoken,
Bring me the dead I cannot save,
And I will carry them beyond the grave,
Bring me the oaths! (Bring them!)
Bring me the oaths! (Bring them!)

[bridge - bass solo with spoken word]
In the name of the Almighty,
In the name of every soldier fallen,
I, Dalinar Kholin,
Challenge Odium to a contest of champions,

[outro]
Oathbringer, Oathbringer,
The sword names the man who swings her,
Not by the blade but by the oath,
I choose redemption, I choose both

tracks.title: Evi's Fire
tracks.prompt: prog rock gospel fusion, intimate and devastating: acoustic guitar fingerpicking in 6/8 with subtle prog complexity, female ghost vocal harmonizing with lead male, building slowly to full gospel lament with weeping strings and organ, male vocals breaking with raw emotion, choir enters softly then swells to overwhelming grief-to-hope arc, 80 BPM rubato feel, the confession track
tracks.lyrics:
[verse 1]
I cannot remember your face, Evi,
The Nightwatcher took it clean,
But the fire remembers everything,
Every scream I should have seen,
You came from Rira gentle and true,
Married the Blackthorn, what could you do,
I was the sword, you were the sheath,
And I burned the world with you beneath,

[chorus]
Forgive me, forgive me,
(Lord have mercy on this man)
Forgive me, forgive me,
(Blood on every hand)
The fire took you, the drink took me,
And the Nightwatcher took my memory,

[verse 2]
Our sons grew up with half a father,
Adolin trying, Renarin shattered,
I gave them war instead of love,
Kingdoms below and ash above,
Now the memories come back like rain,
Each one a gift, each one a pain,
I see your face for the first time twice,
And it costs me everything, but that's the price,

[chorus]
Forgive me, forgive me,
(Lord have mercy on this man)
Forgive me, forgive me,
(Blood on every hand)
The fire took you, the drink took me,
But the next step sets me free,

[bridge - whispered confession]
I did this,
I chose this,
No Thrill, no madness,
Just a man too proud to stop,

[outro - full gospel choir]
And still I rise, and still I kneel,
And still I pray that scars can heal,
The most important step, the most important step,
Is always, always next

tracks.title: I Am Unity
tracks.prompt: prog rock gospel fusion, transcendent climax: opening in full 13/8 prog complexity that gradually simplifies as the man finds clarity, massive gospel choir building from single voice to hundreds, pipe organ and prog synthesizers merging, male vocal raw and absolute, 120 BPM driving forward, the album's spiritual climax, arena-scale congregational anthem, drums building to tribal stomp, brass fanfare in final chorus, triumphant and earned catharsis
tracks.lyrics:
[intro - single voice]
I am Unity,

[verse 1]
Odium stands before the man who kneels,
Not in weakness but in what he feels,
Every sin accounted for and owned,
Every seed of ruin he has sown,
The god of hatred offers absolution,
Give me your pain, that's my solution,
But a man who's walked through his own fire
Knows that pain's the fuel that takes him higher,

[chorus - building congregation]
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
You cannot have my pain!
(You cannot have my pain!)
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
I will not break again!
(Will not break again!)

[verse 2]
The Stormfather trembles, gods take notice,
A mortal man denies the highest offer,
Because he learned from every failure,
Every grave, every coffin, every slaughter,
That the answer isn't less pain,
The answer's more purpose for the pain,
So take your hatred, take your throne,
I'll build my kingdom stone by stone,

[chorus - full congregation]
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
You cannot have my pain!
(You cannot have my pain!)
I am Unity! (I am Unity!)
I will not break again!
(Will not break again!)

[bridge - prog instrumental break into gospel stomp]
Unite them, unite them,
The nations, the orders, the broken and the damned,
Unite them, unite them,
With an open heart and an outstretched hand,

[final chorus - arena scale]
WE ARE UNITY! (We are Unity!)
YOU CANNOT HAVE OUR PAIN!
(You cannot have our pain!)
WE ARE UNITY! (We are Unity!)
WE WILL RISE AGAIN!
(We will rise again!)
Life before death!
(Life before death!)
Strength before weakness!
(Strength before weakness!)
Journey before destination!
(Journey before destination!)
I AM UNITY!
